item.text: In the <st data-num="07970" class="">thirty</st>-<st data-num="08337" class="">sixth</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">year</st> of <st data-num="0609" class="">Asa’s</st> <st data-num="04438" class="">reign</st>, <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="01201" class="">Baasha</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> <st data-num="05927 05921">attacked</st> <st data-num="03063" class="">Judah</st>, and he <st data-num="01129" class="">established</st> <st data-num="07414" class="">Ramah</st> <st data-num="01129" class="">as a military outpost</st> to <st data-num="01115 05414">prevent</st> anyone from <st data-num="03318" class="">leaving</st> or <st data-num="0935" class="">entering</st> the land of <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="0609" class="">Asa</st> of <st data-num="03063" class="">Judah</st>.<n id="1" />
Asa took all the silver and gold that was left in the treasuries of the Lord’s temple and of the royal palace and sent it to King Ben Hadad of Syria, ruler in Damascus, along with this message:

“I <st data-num="0996" class="">want</st> to make a <st data-num="01285" class="">treaty</st> <st data-num="0996" class="">with</st> you, <st data-num="0996 01">like the one</st> our <st data-num="01" class="">fathers</st> <st data-num="0996" class="">made</st>.<n id="1" /> <st data-num="02009" class="">See</st>, I have <st data-num="07971" class="">sent</st> you <st data-num="03701" class="">silver</st> and <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st>. <st data-num="01980 06565">Break</st> your <st data-num="01285" class="">treaty</st> <st data-num="0854" class="">with</st> <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="01201" class="">Baasha</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st>, so he will <st data-num="05927" class="">retreat</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">from</st> my land.”<n id="2" />

<st data-num="01130" class="">Ben Hadad</st> <st data-num="08085 0413">accepted</st> <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="0609" class="">Asa’s</st> <st data-num="08085 0413">offer</st> and <st data-num="07971" class="">ordered</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">his</st> <st data-num="02428" class="">army</st> <st data-num="08269" class="">commanders</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to attack</st> the <st data-num="05892" class="">cities</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st>.<n id="1" /> They <st data-num="05221" class="">conquered</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="05859" class="">Ijon</st>, <st data-num="01835" class="">Dan</st>, <st data-num="066" class="">Abel Maim</st>,<n id="3" /> and <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="04543" class="">storage</st> <st data-num="05892" class="">cities</st> of <st data-num="05321" class="">Naphtali</st>.

<st data-num="01961" class="">When</st> <st data-num="01201" class="">Baasha</st> <st data-num="08085" class="">heard</st> the news, he <st data-num="02308" class="">stopped</st> <st data-num="01129" class="">fortifying</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="07414" class="">Ramah</st> and <st data-num="07673" class="">abandoned</st> the <st data-num="04399" class="">project</st>.<n id="2" />
King Asa ordered all the men of Judah to carry away the stones and wood that Baasha had used to build Ramah. He used the materials to build up Geba and Mizpah.

At that time Hanani the prophet visited King Asa of Judah and said to him: “Because you relied on the king of Syria and did not rely on the Lord your God, the army of the king of Syria has escaped from your hand.
Did not the Cushites and Libyans have a huge army with chariots and a very large number of horsemen? But when you relied on the Lord, he handed them over to you!
Certainly the Lord watches the whole earth carefully and is ready to strengthen those who are devoted to him. You have acted foolishly in this matter; from now on you will have war.”
Asa was so angry at the prophet, he put him in jail. Asa also oppressed some of the people at that time.
The events of Asa’s reign, from start to finish, are recorded in the Scroll of the Kings of Judah and Israel.
In the thirty-ninth year of his reign, Asa developed a foot disease, and his disease became severe. Yet even in his disease, he did not seek the Lord, but only the doctors.

<st data-num="0609" class="">Asa</st> <st data-num="07901 05973 01 04191">passed away</st><n id="1" /> in the <st data-num="0705" class="">forty</st>-<st data-num="0259" class="">first</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">year</st> of his <st data-num="04427" class="">reign</st>.
He was buried in the tomb he had carved out in the City of David. They laid him to rest on a platform covered with spices and assorted mixtures of ointments. They made a huge bonfire to honor him.
